summary: This is a letter from Smith Viltozor LLP to Judge Alison J. Nathan regarding the United States v. Maxwell case. The letter, written on behalf of the independent administrator of the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program, responds to a court order by making an initial production of documents (claim forms, narratives, determination letters, payment records, and releases) for four individuals subpoenaed by Ghislaine Maxwell. The documents are provided on a password-protected thumb drive with redactions per Federal Rule of Civil Procedure 49.1(a).

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: Presiding judge in the Southern District of New York who issued the order denying the motion to quash Maxwell's subpoena and to whom this letter and document production are addressed.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case (United States v. Maxwell) who issued a subpoena to the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program administrator for documents related to four individuals.

connections.description: Judge Nathan is presiding over the criminal case against Maxwell, as indicated by the case caption 'United States v. Maxwell' and the letter's address to her.

events.title: Court Order Denying Motion to Quash Subpoena
events.description: Judge Alison J. Nathan issued an order denying the motion to quash Ghislaine Maxwell's subpoena to the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program administrator and ordering the production of subpoenaed documents.

events.title: Initial Document Production to Court
events.description: Smith Viltozor LLP, representing the independent administrator of the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program, makes an initial production of subpoenaed documents (claim forms, narratives, determination letters, payment records, and releases for four individuals) to Judge Nathan on a password-protected thumb drive.

locations: Southern District of New York, 40 Foley Square, New York, New York 10007
Smith Viltozor LLP, 250 West 55th Street, 30th Floor, New York, NY 10019
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell subpoenaed the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program administrator for documents related to four specific individuals.
The court (Judge Alison J. Nathan) denied a motion to quash that subpoena and ordered document production.
The initial production includes claim forms, narratives, determination letters, payment records, and releases from the four subpoenaed individuals.
The documents have been redacted in accordance with Federal Rule of Civil Procedure 49.1(a).
The law firm Smith Viltozor LLP represents the independent administrator of the compensation program in this matter.
